items.title: Japanese IT firm NTT develops AI chip for drone video analysis
Chinese chip firms see little impact from new US tariffs
items.summary:
• Several Chinese semiconductor companies report minimal impact from recent US import tariffs.
• China raised duties on American goods up to 84% in retaliation.
• Cambricon Technologies mentioned that overseas revenue was less than 1% of total in 2023 and 2024.
• Loongson Technology cites independent R&D and self-sufficient supply chain as reasons for no adverse effects.
• Leaguer Microelectronics sources most materials domestically, earning all revenue in China.
• The situation reflects China's strategy of semiconductor self-sufficiency in response to US restrictions and previous tariff escalations.

items.title: SG investment firm reportedly eyes UK data center operator deal
items.summary:
- SC Capital Partners, based in Singapore, is considering a bid for UK data center operator Global Switch, supported by CapitaLand Investment.
- The potential deal is valued between US$4 billion and US$5 billion, with no agreement finalized as of now.
- Global Switch's appeal arises from increasing demand for digital infrastructure, significantly influenced by AI and cloud computing developments.

items.title: IPhone production shift to US could spike costs by 90%: report
items.author: Wamsi Mohan
items.summary:
- Moving iPhone production to the US could raise manufacturing costs by 25% due to higher domestic labor expenses.
- Potential tariffs may raise total production costs by 90% or more.
- Apple has seen its stock fall 14% since the announcement of new tariffs, despite a 10% jump on Apr. 9.
- Current tariffs are unprecedented, with the US imposing up to 125% on Chinese goods and China retaliating with 84% duties.
- Apple's previous attempts at U.S. manufacturing in the 1980s ended in failure due to strategic misalignment.
- Challenges in replicating the scale and efficiency of manufacturing facilities like Foxconn's Zhengzhou compound in the U.S. are substantial.

items.title: EU suspends tariffs against US to allow trade talks
items.summary:
- The European Union has announced a 90-day suspension of retaliatory tariffs against the US, following a similar pause by President Trump.
- Ursula von der Leyen emphasized the suspension aims to create space for negotiations, warning that countermeasures may resume if talks fail.
- The EU had initially planned higher duties in response to US steel and aluminum tariffs from March, but the US still enforces specific levies on various imports.

items.title: BNPL belongs in grocery stores not in restaurants
items.summary:
- BNPL services are rising in the food and beverage (F&B) and grocery sectors.
- Companies like DoorDash and KFC Malaysia are adopting BNPL for food purchases.
- Critics question the suitability of BNPL for food given the instant consumption nature of meals.
- BNPL could be more beneficial in the grocery segment than in F&B due to repayment challenges after meal consumption.
- The original purpose of BNPL was to assist consumers lacking credit access to manage their payments effectively.

items.title: New and returning investors betting on SEA
items.summary:
- Some investors are returning to the Southeast Asian market after a six-month hiatus.
- Their reinvestment indicates either renewed confidence in the market or new ventures in the region.
- This influx of investors presents more opportunities for startups seeking funding.

items.title: Kopi Kenangan opens its first store in India
items.summary:
- Southeast Asian coffee chain Kopi Kenangan has opened its first store in India on April 10, 2025, at Pacific Mall, Tagore Garden, Delhi.
- India is now the fifth Asian market for Kopi Kenangan, which plans to open over 10 outlets by the end of 2025 and aims for a total of 50 stores.
- The company intends to invest up to 40 crore rupees (over US$4.6 million) in sourcing and retail expansion in the next two years, offering a menu with 35 beverages and 20 food items while sourcing coffee ingredients locally.

items.title: J&T Express delivers 6.6 billion parcels in Q1
items.summary:
- J&T Express handled **6.6 billion parcels** globally in **Q1 2025**, a **31.2%** increase year-on-year.
- The average daily delivery was **73.3 million parcels**.
- Southeast Asia accounted for **1.54 billion parcels**, boosted by partnerships with brands and strong **Ramadan** demand.
- China contributed **4.98 billion parcels** due to improved service quality and rising e-commerce demand.
- Emerging markets like **Saudi Arabia** and **Mexico** saw **76.6 million parcels**, representing **19.4% growth** year-on-year.
- A significant **57.8%** increase in daily parcel volume was noted during **Ramadan**.
- J&T’s expansion and infrastructure investments position it strategically for future logistics growth in the region.

items.title: Love Bonito is dressed up for success
items.summary:
- Love Bonito, a Singapore-based fashion brand, has seen remarkable growth due to effective online and offline strategies.
- The brand targets young women and has successfully transitioned into various markets, including Indonesia and Malaysia.
- Their approach includes personalized customer experiences and social media engagement, contributing to their strong brand loyalty.
- The company emphasizes sustainable fashion and aims to reduce its environmental impact through various initiatives.
- Love Bonito plans to expand further in Southeast Asia and strengthen its e-commerce platform.
- The brand's success is notable in the competitive landscape of fashion retail, especially during challenging economic times.

items.title: Ex-Tesla engineer launches robotics startup Mondo Tech
items.author: Shuo Yang
items.summary:
- Shuo Yang, a former robotics engineer at Tesla, co-founded the startup Mondo Tech in January in Shenzhen with a registered capital of 1 million yuan (approximately US$136,500).
- Mondo Tech is based in Palo Alto, California and Shenzhen, and aims to create smaller robots designed as companions for daily use, inspired by Yang's son.
- Yang announced his departure from Tesla's humanoid robot project, Optimus, on April 9, 2025.

items.title: Musk’s xAI launches Grok 3 access to rival GPT-4, Gemini
items.summary:
- Elon Musk’s xAI has launched an API for Grok 3 AI model, offering a full version and a smaller Grok 3 Mini.
- Pricing starts at US$3 per million input tokens for Grok 3, and US$0.30 for Grok 3 Mini.
- Grok 3 includes a context window of 131,072 tokens, contrary to earlier claims of 1 million tokens.
- The model is designed to compete with GPT-4o and Gemini, though it has faced scrutiny over performance benchmarks.
- Musk aims for Grok to be politically neutral, but earlier biases have been noted.
- Recent evaluations suggest improvements in Grok 3’s neutrality compared to previous versions.

items.title: Indian AI startup unveils tool to run AI without costly chips
items.summary:
- Ziroh Labs introduces Kompact AI, a system that operates large AI models without advanced GPUs, using standard CPUs.
- Developed with IIT Madras, it reduces the need for expensive GPUs and has been tested by Intel and AMD.
- The platform successfully runs models like Meta’s Llama 2 on regular laptops, addressing AI accessibility issues for Indian developers.

items.title: WaveSpeedAI, DataCrunch partner to accelerate AI image output
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- WaveSpeedAI partners with European GPU cloud provider DataCrunch to enhance its FLUX-dev model for generative image and video.
- The collaboration utilizes NVIDIA B200 GPU, achieving inference speeds up to six times faster than industry standards.
- FLUX-dev supports text-to-image and image-to-image generation with 12 billion parameters, focusing on style diversity and scene understanding.
- Goals include optimizing scaling, reducing latency, and operational costs for enterprise machine learning teams.
- Future releases will emphasize efficient video generation inference, using advanced hardware from DataCrunch.

items.title: India’s 3one4 leads $10m round of logistic startup Xindus
items.summary:
- Indian logistics startup Xindus raised $10 million in Series A funding, led by 3one4 Capital.
- Xindus was founded in 2022 and offers a full-stack platform for SMEs involved in global trade, covering shipping, warehousing, compliance, returns, and financial flows.
- The funding aims to help Xindus expand over the next 12 to 18 months, targeting to increase gross merchandise value from $30 million to $200 million amid growing investor interest in India's logistics sector.

items.title: Fintech Firm Solid Files for Bankruptcy
items.summary:
- Banking-as-a-service startup Solid filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on April 7, 2025.
- Solid, formerly known as Wise, was founded in 2018 and raised nearly US$81 million in funding, with a last valuation of US$330 million in August 2022.
- The company aimed to provide banking, payments, cards, and cryptocurrency products through APIs for fintech companies.
- Solid is seeking to restructure or sell its business as part of the bankruptcy process.
- Solid's bankruptcy reflects ongoing challenges in the BaaS industry, paralleling Synapse's collapse due to systemic issues and regulatory scrutiny.
- Investor litigation, including claims of misrepresentation by FTV Capital, highlights the heightened legal risks in the fintech sector.

items.title: Southeast Asia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's startup ecosystem includes successful companies like Grab and Sea Group.
- Investors are competing to identify the region's next leading tech firm.
- The article encourages readers to subscribe for full access to charts and detailed insights.

items.title: Adobe brings agentic AI to Photoshop, Premiere Pro
items.summary:
- Adobe announces plans to integrate agentic AI in its product ecosystem to enhance productivity and creativity.
- Upcoming AI-driven features will be available in Adobe Acrobat, Adobe Express, Photoshop, and Premiere Pro.
- Agentic AI will perform tasks through user interaction; specific release dates for these features are not provided, but more capabilities are expected in the coming months.

items.title: SEA fintech funding drops to $193m in Q1 2025: report
items.summary:
- Funding in Southeast Asia's fintech sector totaled $193 million in Q1 2025, a 30% decline from Q4 2024 and 66% lower than Q1 2024.
- January was the most active month, accounting for 57% of total funding.
- Seed-stage funding decreased by 52% year-on-year to $34.1 million; early-stage funding dropped by 68% to $101 million; late-stage funding saw a decrease to $58 million from $195 million last year.
- Sygnum raised $58 million in a Series C round, becoming the only fintech unicorn in 2025.
- Singapore led with 74% of total funding, followed by Thu Duc and Petaling Jaya.
- The quarter recorded six acquisitions, including Titanlab's $30 million purchase of Coinseeker.
- Despite the funding drop, digital adoption and sector-specific strategies are driving growth.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Chinese Amazon sellers struggle, seek new markets
items.summary:
- Chinese e-commerce businesses on Amazon are considering price increases or market exit due to new US tariffs.
- President Trump announced a tariff increase on Chinese imports from 104% to 125%.
- Wang Xin from Shenzhen Cross-Border E-Commerce Association stated the tariffs represent an "unprecedented blow," likely impacting small Chinese businesses and increasing unemployment.

items.title: Google integrates Anthropic’s protocol to enhance AI models
items.summary:
- Google is integrating Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol (MCP) into its Gemini models and SDK as announced by CEO Demis Hassabis on April 9, 2025.
- MCP allows AI models to access and interact with data from multiple sources, improving task completion through two-way connections.
- Since its open-sourcing, MCP has been adopted by numerous companies including Block, Apollo, Replit, and Codeium.

items.title: TSMC beats Q1 forecasts with $25.5b revenue
items.summary:
- TSMC reported Q1 revenue of NT$839.25 billion (US$25.5 billion) on Apr. 10, exceeding forecasts of NT$835.66 billion (US$25.15 billion).
- The company benefits from strong demand for chips used in AI applications, maintaining 64.9% market share in semiconductor manufacturing.
- TSMC experiences a 32% year-over-year revenue increase, reflecting continued growth in AI sectors despite broader industry slowdowns.

items.title: CATL said to gain approval for $5b HK listing
items.summary:
- China’s battery manufacturer CATL is expected to receive approval for its Hong Kong listing.
- The listing aims to raise at least US$5 billion, with approval anticipated on Apr. 10, 2025.
- CATL holds a 37.9% share in the global EV battery market despite recent challenges.
- The IPO would be the largest in Hong Kong since Kuaishou Technology in early 2021.
- CATL's financial resilience is highlighted by a 15% profit growth despite a revenue decline.
- The listing signals confidence in Hong Kong’s capital markets amid market turbulence.
- CATL is also exploring vertical integration strategies, including acquiring a stake in Nio’s power unit.

items.title: Nvidia avoids US export ban on its H20 chips
US VC firm Lerer Hippeau raises $200m fund
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- New York-based venture capital firm Lerer Hippeau raised $200 million for its ninth flagship fund.
- The firm is deploying capital from its fourth select fund, with approximately one-third committed.
- NYC's tech ecosystem has evolved, now significantly advancing in AI, cloud infrastructure, and app-layer technologies.
- New York ranks as the second-largest startup ecosystem in the U.S., supporting over 40,000 AI professionals and attracting $27 billion in AI-related funding since 2019.
- Lerer Hippeau has raised progressively larger funds despite a 42% drop in overall venture funding in 2023, indicating maturity in NYC's venture ecosystem.

items.title: Google eases in-car rules after German antitrust deal
items.summary:
- Google reached an agreement with Germany’s Federal Cartel Office regarding its automotive services, ending an antitrust investigation from 2023.
- The changes will address competition concerns and are set to apply across Europe.
- Google will allow third-party services in vehicle infotainment systems and remove restrictions preventing the usage of its map services with competitors like Here, Mapbox, and TomTom.

items.title: German AI clean energy firm 1Komma5 delays IPO over US tariffs
items.summary:
- German clean energy startup 1Komma5 has postponed its Nasdaq IPO originally set for 2025.
- Decision influenced by market volatility and recent US tariff policies.
- The company, valued over US$1 billion, is reassessing its listing strategy due to global economic uncertainty.
- CEO Philipp Schroeder cited US trade policies as a significant factor in changing the IPO timeline.
- This move reflects a broader trend of European tech firms reconsidering US listings.

items.title: 7-Eleven operator plans $4b share buyback
items.summary:
- Seven & i Holdings Co. announces a ¥600 billion ($4 billion) share buyback, part of a ¥2 trillion ($13.63 billion) initiative to enhance shareholder value.
- The stock rose by 9.4% in Tokyo following the announcement, the largest intraday gain since March 6.
- The company is also divesting its superstore business and banking unit, projecting a ¥424 billion ($2.89 billion) operating profit for fiscal year ending February 2026, below analyst expectations.
- Expected sales decline of 10% to ¥10.76 trillion ($73.32 billion) due to economic uncertainties, including trade policy risks.
- Seven & i faces operational challenges with a forecasted domestic convenience store sales rise of 9.4% and overseas revenue decline of 3.6%.
- The company plans to return approximately ¥2 trillion to shareholders by FY2030 while investing in operational improvements.

items.title: TikTok deal possible as ByteDance faces 2025 deadline: Trump
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump stated on Apr. 9, 2025, that a deal to separate TikTok’s US operations remains possible.
- The deal's progress has reportedly stalled, prompting Trump to extend the deadline for ByteDance to Jun. 19, 2025.
- A proposed plan aims to create a new US-based entity, reducing Chinese ownership to alleviate national security concerns.

items.title: Google enhances Gemini Code Assist with AI, new tools
items.summary:
- On Apr. 10, Google announced updates to Gemini Code Assist, its AI coding assistant.
- New features include "agentic" capabilities for multi-step programming tasks and the ability to translate code between languages.
- Code Assist is now integrated into Android Studio and includes a Kanban board for task management.

items.title: Kia cuts 2030 EV sales target to 1.26 million units
items.summary:
- Kia Corporation revised its 2030 electric vehicle (EV) sales target from 1.6 million to 1.26 million units as of April 9.
- The company plans to sell 993,000 hybrid vehicles by 2030, reflecting a strategic shift towards a balanced electrification strategy.
- The revision is attributed to increasing uncertainty in U.S. automotive policy, impacting long-term planning and investment strategies for EV adoption.

items.title: Walmart expects US ecommerce profit this year
items.summary:
- Walmart Inc. anticipates profitability in its US ecommerce operations this year as stated by CFO John David Rainey.
- The company has invested significantly to enhance its online presence and compete with Amazon.
- Walmart has expanded its third-party seller marketplace with a more extensive selection of brands and categories like pre-owned luxury items.
- New services, such as same-day pharmacy delivery, have been introduced, with over 30% of online orders utilizing these expedited options.
- Supply chain upgrades have led to cost reductions and improved shipping efficiency.
- Walmart aims to reach 95% of US households within three hours by late 2025, predicting ecommerce will contribute to about 50% of sales growth in the next five years.
- Ecommerce sales have seen a growth from 4.8% in 2018 to 17.8% in 2024, highlighting the increasing focus on digital channels.

items.title: Anthropic launches new Claude subscription plan
items.summary:
- Anthropic introduces a new AI chatbot subscription plan named Max.
- Pricing set at $100 and $200 per month, offering higher usage limits than the $20 Claude Pro.
- $100 plan allows five times the usage limits of Claude Pro, and the $200 plan offers twenty times the limits.
- No unlimited usage option announced for Claude, unlike OpenAI’s ChatGPT Pro.
- Multi-tiered subscription model reflects a broader SaaS trend, showing high customer lifetime values.
- AI subscription pricing is driven by the computational costs of running advanced AI models.
- Recent research indicates a notable shift in enterprise adoption of AI tools for productivity improvements.

items.title: Tesla stock jumps 18% as Trump pauses tariffs
items.summary:
- On Apr. 9, President Donald Trump announced a pause on most reciprocal tariff hikes, impacting Tesla’s stock performance.
- The announcement led to an 18% increase in Tesla shares, reaching nearly US$262 per share by mid-afternoon.
- This tariff pause does not apply to China, which faces increased tariffs of 125% due to retaliatory actions against American products.
- Tesla CEO Elon Musk criticized the tariff policy, advocating for a "zero-tariff situation" between Europe and North America.
- The tariff pause represents a temporary reprieve for Tesla, which relies on 20-25% of its car parts from China.
- Despite manufacturing in the U.S., Tesla's sales in China exceeded $2 billion in 2017, indicating dependence on the Chinese market.
- Tesla delivered 336,681 vehicles in Q1, below industry estimates, reflecting weakening demand amid political controversies.
- Musk’s lobbying against tariffs highlights the influence of corporate leaders on economic policy, with Tesla's stock gaining over $100 billion in market capitalization in one day after the announcement.

items.title: Japan’s Zozo to acquire UK luxury fashion platform Lyst for $154m
items.summary:
- Zozo has acquired UK-based luxury fashion marketplace Lyst for $154 million in cash.
- Lyst was valued at $700 million in 2021 and will operate as a stand-alone business under CEO Emma McFerran.
- The acquisition is part of a trend of e-commerce companies facing valuation corrections post-pandemic, as Lyst's revenue remains flat despite having 160 million users.
- The competitive landscape for fashion e-commerce is intensifying, with Lyst's model being pressured by both mass-market giants and specialty platforms.
- Zozo aims to leverage Lyst's customer base and integrate advanced AI capabilities to enhance competitiveness globally.

items.title: Democrats urge Trump to oust Musk
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- A group of 77 House Democrats is urging President Trump to remove Elon Musk from his government role by May 30.
- They cite legal limits on the tenure of special government employees, stating Musk cannot serve beyond 130 days under federal law.
- The lawmakers requested Musk to resign and give up all decision-making authority by the deadline, with a note that he would be barred from a similar role within a year unless he divests from his companies like Tesla and SpaceX.

items.title: Nazara’s subsidiary Nodwin Gaming enters US esports market
items.summary:
- Nodwin Gaming expands into the US esports market by creating a new entity, Nodwin Gaming USA Inc., in Delaware.
- The new entity is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Nodwin Gaming International Pte Ltd, based in Singapore.
- This move follows Nazara’s approval of a 64 crore rupee ($7.68 million) investment in Nodwin Singapore for global expansion nearly five months ago.

items.title: Motion heard to add 15 plaintiffs in TSMC lawsuit
items.summary:
- A federal court in San Jose is considering a motion to add 15 Arizona-based plaintiffs in an employment discrimination lawsuit against TSMC.
- The lawsuit, filed in August 2024 and refiled as a class action in November, alleges favoritism towards East Asian workers and a hostile environment for non-East Asian employees.
- TSMC has invested $65 billion in Arizona and plans an additional $100 billion investment announced in March 2025, complicated by these allegations.

items.title: Google adds AI tools to boost Workspace productivity
Wise to Open New Hub in India, Hire Hundreds in Tech Roles
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Wise to open a new hub in Hyderabad, India, in the second half of 2025 as part of its expansion.
- Plans to hire hundreds in product, engineering, and operations roles led by Smrithi Ravi, APAC head of engineering.
- New feature launched for Indian businesses to receive international payments in 8 currencies at mid-market exchange rates.
- Wise aims to grow its services in India, which it has been operating since 2013, processing about 10% of all remittances to the country.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Amazon cancels China, Asia orders
items.summary:
- Amazon cancels orders for products from China and other Asian countries after new US tariffs on over 180 regions.
- Affected items include beach chairs, scooters, and air conditioners; vendors received little notice on cancellations.
- Cancellations shift tariff burden back to vendors and impact Amazon’s direct import orders, where they would pay tariffs themselves.

items.title: China’s Noematrix raises pre-A++ round for embodied AI
items.author: Lu Cewu, Wang Shiquan
items.summary:
- Embodied AI startup Noematrix raised between $30 million and $70 million in its pre-A++ funding round.
- Investors included Shengyu Investment, Zero2IPO Capital, Vision Knight Capital, and existing investors Prosperity7 and Sequoia China.
- Funds are aimed at enhancing AI models, data acquisition systems, and expanding commercial trials in various sectors.
- Founded in late 2023, Noematrix has completed four funding rounds and has a flagship product called Noematrix Brain.
- The CoMiner data system launched six months ago has secured nearly 100 orders and aims to improve data collection for AI development.

items.title: Wanted: First movers for Southeast Asia’s agentic AI leap
items.explanation: Fire can easily burn through a pass; no entry without a little heat!

items.title: India’s funding round sizes over the past 5 years
Indian B2B unicorn OfBusiness cuts tech staff by 25%
items.summary:
- OfBusiness has reduced its tech workforce by 25% due to the adoption of Generative AI (GenAI).
- Co-founder Nitin Jain announced the cuts during Inc42’s GenAI Summit on April 9.
- The company claims that operational efficiency remains unaffected by the integration of AI technologies.

items.title: Alphabet to invest $75b in AI, data centers: CEO
items.author: Sundar Pichai
items.summary:
- Alphabet plans to invest $75 billion in 2025 to expand data center capacity.
- CEO Sundar Pichai made the announcement on April 9, 2025, during a Google cloud conference.
- Funding aims to support Alphabet's core services and AI initiatives like Gemini AI model.
- This investment is part of a broader industry-wide AI infrastructure spending surge expected to exceed $320 billion in 2025.
- The commitment reflects Alphabet's view of AI as a strategic priority despite market concerns over return on investment.

items.title: OpenAI files countersuit against Musk
items.summary:
- OpenAI has filed a countersuit against Elon Musk, alleging harassment.
- The countersuit seeks to hold Musk accountable for damages and prevent further interference.
- Filed in the US District Court for the Northern District of California on April 9, 2025, it claims Musk has engaged in unfair practices during ongoing litigation regarding OpenAI's for-profit transition.
- Musk co-founded OpenAI in 2015 but has criticized its shift to for-profit, having started his own AI firm, xAI, in 2023.
- OpenAI argues this transition is necessary to secure $40 billion in funding by year-end.
- The legal battle is part of broader challenges facing AI development, including copyright lawsuits from The New York Times and prominent authors against OpenAI.

items.title: Google launches Ironwood AI chip for cloud computing
items.summary:
- Google unveiled the Ironwood chip at the Cloud Next conference, its seventh-generation TPU AI accelerator.
- The chip is designed for running AI models and will be available to Google Cloud customers later this year.
- Ironwood features clusters of 256 and 9,216 chips, offering up to 4,614 TFLOPs with 192GB RAM and 7.4 Tbps bandwidth per chip.
- An upgraded SparseCore technology enhances performance, reducing latency and improving energy efficiency.
- The launch reflects a shift in focus from model training to large-scale deployment of AI applications.

items.title: Reddit’s conversational AI search tool uses Google Gemini
items.summary:
- Reddit integrated Google Gemini into its conversational AI search tool, Reddit Answers, announced on April 9.
- Reddit Answers has been in beta since December 2024 and allows users to ask questions for curated summaries of posts and comments.
- The Google Gemini integration aims to enhance search relevance and provide faster responses and is currently available in English on web and iOS in the US.

items.title: Apple supplier Luxshare explores production shift over US tariffs
items.summary:
- Luxshare is considering moving production outside China due to US tariffs, with potential investments in the US market.
- Chairwoman Wang Laichun stated that tariffs would have limited profit impact but could benefit localization for US customers.
- The company is evaluating further investment in Southeast Asia, though Vietnam and India are currently unlikely options.
- Setting up a new production line can take up to 18 months, and no specific customers, including Apple, were named during the analyst call.
- Luxshare's production shift is part of a broader industry trend of moving away from China, exacerbated by rising Chinese labor costs and the pandemic.
- New tariff structures create substantial cost differentials, with tariffs on electronics from China at approximately 54% versus 26% for India and 36% for Thailand.
- Challenges exist in relocating manufacturing, including unmatched efficiency in China’s supply chain and potential quality control issues in new locations.
